You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of 1 hour for each question.- You should record all your observations in the spaces provided in the question paper as soon as these observations are made.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 633, 212, 647]]<|/det|> ## INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 649, 728, 680]]<|/det|> INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[712, 710, 905, 838]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[125, 103, 707, 119]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate a light-dependent resistor (LDR).

<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 410, 467, 426]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 440, 184, 456]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 440, 918, 473]]<|/det|>

<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 487, 920, 519]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 918, 104]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 120, 575, 136]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 147, 691, 167]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[129, 102, 735, 118]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the elastic properties of rubber cord.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 132, 136, 148]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 132, 918, 165]]<|/det|>
<pre>(i) You are provided with a wire with a clip and two slotted masses attached, as shown in Fig. 2.1.  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[256, 177, 741, 348]]<|/det|>
<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 362, 532, 378]]<|/det|>
<pre>Fig. 2.1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 392, 905, 408]]<|/det|>
The distance between the centres of the two slotted masses is \(B\) , as shown in Fig. 2.1.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 422, 386, 438]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(B\) .  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[552, 564, 885, 580]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 594, 184, 610]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 594, 815, 610]]<|/det|>
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in your value of \(B\) . Show your working.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[375, 796, 920, 812]]<|/det|>
<pre>percentage uncertainty = .................................................... % [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 73, 136, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 73, 184, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 73, 834, 89]]<|/det|>
\(\cdot\) You are provided with two lengths of rubber cord. Select the longer cord.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 104, 477, 120]]<|/det|>
\(\cdot\) The diameter of the cord is \(d\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[233, 134, 422, 150]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(d\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[555, 178, 680, 194]]<|/det|>
<form>\(d =\) .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 210, 184, 226]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 210, 918, 242]]<|/det|>
\(\cdot\) Suspend the clip, wire and masses using the longer cord secured in the two clips, as shown in Fig. 2.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 254, 858, 650]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 661, 590, 677]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 691, 218, 707]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[233, 691, 782, 707]]<|/det|>
The length of cord between the two clips is \(L\), as shown in Fig. 2.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[233, 721, 423, 737]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(L\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[555, 765, 680, 781]]<|/det|>
<form>\(L =\) .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[52, 32, 415, 67]]<|/det|>
<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[120, 73, 136, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 650, 89]]<|/det|>
It is suggested that the relationship between \(T, B, L\) and \(d\) is

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 100, 536, 129]]<|/det|>
\[
T^{2}=\frac{B^{2} L}{k d^{4}}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 139, 338, 155]]<|/det|>
where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 170, 184, 186]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 170, 547, 186]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 403, 865, 419]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[885, 420, 916, 436]]<|/det|>

<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 450, 850, 466]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 572, 136, 588]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 572, 749, 588]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 602, 184, 618]]<|/det|>
